details.title: Bills listed for consideration in Rajya Sabha
details.content:
• Fugitive Economic Offenders Bill, Negotiable Instruments (Amend) Bill.
  •  The Negotiable Instruments (Amendment) Bill, 2018
  •  The National Council for Teacher Education (Amendment) Bill, 2018.

details.title: Bills listed for consideration in Lok Sabha
details.content:
• Trafficking of Persons (Prevention, Protection and Rehabilitation) Bill.
  •  Homeopathy Central Council (Amendment) Bill.
  •  Criminal Law (Amendment) Bill, Constitution (123rd Amendment) Bill.

details.title: Claims of fulfilling 90% of promises made in AP Reorganisation Act 'is misleading': Chandrababu Naidu
details.content: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu asks his MPs to consider moving a privilege motion against the Prime Minister and Union Ministers. Naidu said Centre claiming it has fulfilled 90% of the promises made in AP Reorganisation Act: is misleading, said Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu.

details.title: TDP MPs stage protest
details.content: TDP MP's stage a protest outside the parliament House demanding implemation of Andhra Pradesh re-organisation Act. (Photo | EPS/ Shekhar Yadav)
Congress MP KC Venugopal has given adjournment notice in Lok Sabha over NEET data leak matter. (ANI)

details.title: Nirmala Sitharaman arrives at the Parliament
details.content: Defence minister Nirmala Sitaraman arrives at Parliament House. (Photo| Shekhar Yadav/ EPS)

details.title: Internet penetration doubled since 2014: Manoj Sinha
details.content: Internet penetration has been growing rapidly. The amount of Internet penetration has doubled in India since 2014, said communication minister Manoj Sinha in Lok Sabha.
1, 2,180,98 youths have been employed under the Business process outsourcing (BPO)scheme: IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad

details.title: I want more men in Parliament to raise issues on women's safety: Jaya Bachchan
details.content: Jaya Bachchan thanks media for bringing forward sensitive issues on rapes and lynchings. She added, "I'd like to see male members in the house to speak about the ongoing atrocities against women".

details.title: Can farmers' benefit from bullet trains? asks Mallikarju Kharge
details.content: Countering Piyush Goyal's claims of laying tracks for bullet train, Congress leader Mallikarju Kharge says,"will farmers afford to carry their vegetables in the train?"

details.title: Ruckus in Lok Sabha
details.content: Opposition raised slogans in Lok Sabha as Piyush Goyal slammed Congress leader Mallikarju Kharge for not fulfilling his duties as former Railway Minister of India.Goyal also added that the BJP government belives in holistic development.

details.title: Military budget raised in Lok Sabha
details.content: BJP MP from Odisha, Pinaki Mishra raised the military buget in the lower house of the Parliament. He said,"there is a five times disparity between the military expenditures between India and China, we know that China is encircling us.How long are our youths going to be martyred owing to the lack of military expenditure?"

details.title: INC MP KC Venugopal raises NEET data leak during Lok Sabha zero hour, calls it theft of privacy
details.content: The NEET data of 2 lakh students have been leaked which questions the ability of CBSC to keep the sanctity of examination process. Buyers were ready to pay upto Rs 2 lakhs for the personal data of students: KC Venugopa
Lok Sabha adjourned till 12.30 pm

details.title: Speaker accepts Congress' privilege motion against PM Narendra Modi
details.content:
Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge moves privilege motion against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Jyotiraditya Scindia moved the motion  against defence minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

Speaker Sumitra Mahajan said the motions are consideration.

details.title: We have asked Myanmar government to take back Rohingya refugees: Kiren Rijiju
details.content: Central government has issued an advisory to identify the Rohingyas and take their biometric. After that we will ensure that they do not poses any papers to claim Indian citizenship. Once the process is over, we will ask the government of Myanmar to take back the Rohingya refugees: Home Minister Rajnath Singh
Rajya Sabha to reconvene at 2 pm.
Lok Sabha adjourned till 2.25 pm.

details.title: DMK President MK Stalin demands Nirmala Sitharaman's resignation
details.content:
DMK working president MK Stalin demands resignation of Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for providing air ambulance to the brother of Dy CM OPS; he also says OPS should also step down in this regard @NewIndianXpress

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) July 25, 2018

details.title: Rohingyas won't be allowed to thrive in India : Kiren Rijiju
details.content:
The govt has a clear stand on Rohingya issue. They are illegal and won't be allowed to thrive in India: Kiren Rijiju, MoS Home pic.twitter.com/4uq3LsHTjz

— ANI (@ANI) July 25, 2018

details.title: Mallikarjun Kharge slams PM Narendra Modi's visit to Uganda
details.content: PM is out on a 5-day tour when the Parliament session is on. The meeting could have been avoided. It was not an inevitable meeting. But, since he has the absolute majority, he chooses to go on foreign tours and skips Parliament sessions: Mallikarjun Kharge, Congress (ANI)

details.title: Rajya Sabha reconvenes
details.content:
Rajya Sabha reconvenes, Union Minister Piyush Goyal moves motion for consideration of Fugitive Economic Offender's Bill (2018).

The law will allow authorities to attach personal property of the fugitives with the case against them.

details.title: Rajya Sabha reconvenes
details.content:

The law will allow authorities to attach personal property of the fugitives with the case against them.

details.title: Lok Sabha reconvenes
details.content: Lok Sabha reconvenes with discussion on flood and drought situation in various parts of country.
